_header: Upon the Midsummer even merriest of nights
Title(s): ‘The tretis of the tua mariit wemen and the wedo’
Subjects: women, against; debates; courtly love, burlesque of
_description: William Dunbar, ‘The tretis of the tua mariit wemen and the wedo’ — 530 lines in non-rhyming alliterative long lines

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Apon the midsummer evin mirriest of nichtisI muvit furth allane
                    meid as midnicht wes pas[ ]…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Off thir thre wantoun wyffis þat I haue writtin
                    heirQuhilk wald ȝe waill to ȝour wyf gif ȝe suld wed
                    ane
CamMagPep2553.Attributed Author:
compylit be maister William Dunbar (p. 81); Quod maister Williame Dunbar
                    (p. 96)
CamMagPep2553.Attributed Title:
Heir beginis the tretis of the tua mariit wemen and the wedo compylit be
                    maister William Dunbar (p. 81)
